snippet: Kurdish militias have joined the fighting in Syria and are seeking autonomy, raising fears of balkanization if the government of President Bashar al-Assad falls.
abstract: Kurdish militias have joined fighting in Syria and are seeking autonomy, raising fears of balkanization if government of President Bashar al-Assad falls.

byline.contributor: Sebnem Arsu contributed reporting from Ceylanpinar, and an employee of The New York Times from Ras al-Ain, Syria.

lead_paragraph: Kurdish militias have joined the fighting in Syria and are seeking autonomy, raising fears of balkanization if the government of President Bashar al-Assad falls.

headline.seo: Wider Chaos Feared as Syrian Rebels and Kurds Clash
headline.main: Wider Chaos Feared as Syrian Rebels Clash With Kurds
headline.print_headline: Fears of Deeper Sectarian Strife in Syria
